Pre-Game Insights: Moldova take on Malta in Saturday's Nations League clash, where the hosts are seen as the favorites.
A key player for the home side is Ion Nicolaescu, currently plying his trade at Heerenveen. His goal-scoring ability should be crucial in breaking down Malta's defense.
Malta, on the other hand, have struggled away from home, and their form on the road remains a concern.
Despite having no injury worries, Malta will need to put in a disciplined and cohesive performance to stand a chance.
However, their lack of cutting-edge quality might prove to be their downfall.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Moldova played their first game as an independent country on July 2, 1991.
They recorded a 5-0 win over Pakistan in Amman, Jordan, in their second international game.
Moldova crushed Montenegro 5-2 in Podgorica in the 2014 World Cup qualifiers.
Russian Premier League star Alexandru Gatcan is considered one of the most famous Moldavian footballers.
